intro: Eriospermum erinum, commonly known as the silky eriosperm, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive silvery appearance. Its small, yellowish flowers are typically arranged in dense clusters, and it produces a unique type of fruit called a cypsela. Eriospermum erinum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience in arid conditions.
